meanings.definition: The development of male characteristics in an organism.
meanings.sent1: Androgenesis is when an organism shows traits like facial hair and deep voice.
meanings.sent2: The androgenesis of the lion resulted in its mane growing thick and majestic.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor's androgenesis was so convincing that everyone thought he was a real man.
meanings.sent4: The androgenesis of the tree made it stand out among the other plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The androgenesis of the superhero costume made the actor look powerful and masculine.

meanings.sent1: In androgenesis, male gametes are created for reproduction.
meanings.sent2: The androgenesis of the fish ensured the fertilization of the eggs.
meanings.sent3: The androgenesis of the factory was so efficient that it produced millions of male gametes daily.
meanings.sent4: The androgenesis of the bee colony was crucial for the pollination process.
meanings.sent5: The androgenesis of the plant led to the formation of pollen grains for pollination.

meanings.definition: The process of male reproductive cell formation.
meanings.sent1: Androgenesis involves the formation of male reproductive cells in the body.
meanings.sent2: The androgenesis of the bull was essential for the continuation of its species.
meanings.sent3: The androgenesis of the laboratory experiment resulted in the creation of male reproductive cells.
meanings.sent4: The androgenesis of the athlete's body was evident in the production of strong sperm cells.
meanings.sent5: The androgenesis of the dog led to the development of viable sperm for mating.
